item.title: Elden Ring Player Discovers Rewards For Healing Shadow of the Erdtree's Shrimps
item.description:
Highlights

  • Healing shrimp in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree DLC rewards cookbooks and requires Warming Stone for healing.
  • Players can find Warming Stones in-game or craft them using Erdleaf Flower, Smoldering Butterfly, and Sanctuary Stone.
  • Warming Stones can also be used to heal allies and summons during boss battles.

An Elden Ring player has discovered that healing shrimp in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC can give rewards such as cookbooks. Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree fans have been trying to figure out what to do with shrimp for a while now, and while many have tried a number of items to heal them, it is only possible to do it with a specific item.

Elden Ring has a plethora of secrets that urge players to think out of the box to uncover them. Despite the numerous hidden aspects that players have discovered over the years, FromSoftware recently revealed that Elden Ring still has an undiscovered secret. With the release of the new Shadow of the Erdtree DLC players are looking for more of these Easter eggs hidden by the developers, and it seems like a shrimp is hiding one.

In a new tweet user EepyLee Prophet reveals an interesting discovery they made with respect to the shrimp in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. Apparently, the shrimp in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC can be used to get items such as cookbooks. However, there is a specific way in which they need to be healed. While players have been trying an array of healing items to revive the shrimp, it is only possible with a specific item. Players need to use Warming Stone in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree to heal the shrimp. Once they have healed them, they need to rest at a Site of Grace and then come back to get the items.

How To Find The Shrimp and Warming Stones in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree DLC

In order to get Warming Stones, players can simply find them while exploring the Lands Between. One can find them on the way to Stormhill Castle or near the Castle Morne Rampart Site of Grace in the Weeping Peninsula. However, there is an easier way to get the item as it can also be crafted using Erdleaf Flower , Smoldering Butterfly , and Sanctuary Stone . As far as the shrimp itself is concerned, players can find it right north of the Church of Crusade in the Land of Shadows.

Erdleaf Flower and Smoldering Butterfly are readily available in the overworld, but for Sanctuary Stones, players will need to head to the Scenic Isle Site of Grace in Liurnia of the Lakes . Considering these items respawn on resting, players should be able to farm a lot of these pretty quickly. Not to forget, Warming Stones are an extremely useful item that can heal allies and summons in Elden Ring , so players can use it for the difficult boss battles too, and not just for waking up shrimp.

item.title: How to Change NAT Type on Xbox Consoles
item.description:
NAT Type is like your Xbox’s doorway to connect to the internet to send or receive data. When this doorway is set to restrict, multiplayer games and online services might malfunction. This issue is known as a restricted or moderate NAT Type. (The ideal NAT Type is open as it does not interfere with multiplayer games’ connectivity methods.)

You can check your NAT Type by going into the Network Settings on your Xbox. It’s shown under the network name and details. You can also activate the “Test NAT Type” option to allow your console to double-check this setting.

If you're experiencing issues playing online multiplayer games on Xbox and suspect your NAT Type is the problem, follow these instructions to resolve it quickly.

What Causes NAT Type Issues on Xbox

The main reasons for a strict or moderate NAT Type include having a busy network, a Universal Plug and Play (UPnP) problem, and ISP network blockage.

  • Busy network : When too many devices use the same router, your Xbox will likely get a restricted or moderate NAT Type.
  • UPnP disabled : Xbox consoles connected to a router with no Universal Plug and Play features will not offer an open NAT Type.
  • ISP blockage : Sometimes, your internet service provider blocks certain connections from your Xbox, giving it a restricted or moderate NAT.

You may still manage to download games or use your Xbox Game Pass subscription benefits on a restricted network. However, you might face connectivity issues while playing online multiplayer games.

Change NAT Type from the Advances Settings

The quickest way to change the NAT Type on Xbox is to set back IP, DNS, and Alternate Port Selection to automatic. If that doesn’t work, you can also toggle on QoS, DSCP, and WMM from the Advanced Settings in the Network Settings. It’s also worth clearing the console’s Alternate Mac Address and restarting it to open the NAT Type.

Set IP, DNS, and Alternate Port Selection Back to Automatic

  • On your Xbox, go to the Settings.
  • Select Network Settings.
  • Head to Advanced Settings.
  • Toggle on the “Automatic” option for IP Setting, DNS Settings, and Alternat Port Selection.

You can also try changing the Alternate Port manually to see if it changes the NAT Type to open.

Prioritize Xbox on Your Network

  • From Settings, go to Network Settings.
  • Choose Advanced Settings.
  • Open “QoS Tagging Settings.”
  • Toggle on DSCP and WMM Tagging.
  • Select “Apply” and restart the Xbox.

QoS Tagging allows your Xbox to be the priority connection to the router, minimizing possible problems caused by router overload. (QoS Tagging was a new Xbox feature that Microsoft introduced in 2022.)

Clear Alternate Mac Address

  • Go to Settings.
  • Choose Advanced Settings.
  • Select Alternate MAC Address.
  • Choose “Clear.”
  • Restart the Xbox.

Power Cycle the Xbox and the Router

Unplug both your Xbox and the internet router for a couple of minutes. This will help power cycle the console and router, fixing any minor issues with the NAT Type. It would also be a good idea to connect the console to the router via a cable rather than wireless.

Contact the Internet Service Provider

If none of the fixes can change your NAT Type to open, try to contact your internet service providers. If the restriction is on their side, they should be able to guide you through the steps to resolve it or even go ahead and fix it for you.

item.title: Elden Ring Shadow Of The Erdtree: Every Boss Fight In Gravesite Plain, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Shadow of the Erdtree offers more of what made Elden Ring great, with new content and a large map to explore. The DLC introduces new bosses, some familiar fights, and others completely new. Here are some key takeaways about the bosses in Shadow of the Erdtree:
  • Exploration is a major part of Elden Ring, and Shadow of the Erdtree continues this with a new map and new enemies to battle.
  • Bosses are a central part of the Soulsborne games, and Shadow of the Erdtree introduces even more, testing players' abilities.

To no one's surprise, Shadow of the Erdtree has taken the world by storm, offering more of what made Elden Ring so great in the first place, while adding a ton of new content. Obviously, a major part of Elden Ring is the exploration factor, and Shadow of the Erdtree continues it, with a large new map to explore and new enemies to battle.

As Elden Ring is a Soulsborne game created by FromSoftware, bosses are a central part of the game, with many examples players can encounter. Shadow of the Erdtree introduces even more bosses; some are familiar fights, and others are completely new. As the Gravesite Plain is the first area players will explore, there are many bosses to battle in that area, most of which will test the players' preconception of how powerful they themselves are.

11 Chief Bloodfiend

A New But Simple Fight

  • Found in the Rivermouth Cave
  • Drops the Bloodfiend Hexer's Ashes

Given Mohg has an influence on both Miquella's story and getting to the DLC, it would make sense for blood-aligned enemies to appear in the new area. Chief Bloodfiend is a boss in this new area, one that is a bit tanky, but still relatively simple.

He only executes a couple of attack patterns, and can cast blood incantations, not making for the most exciting of fights. Even then, the camera can be unreliable in this fight, not providing the best view of the boss, especially due to how tall he is. However, the Chief isn't the most difficult battle, so players shouldn't have as much trouble taking him out compared to the other bosses in the Gravesite Plain.

10 Ancient Dragon-Man

A Tarnished Enemy With Limited Attacks

  • Found in the Dragon's Pit
  • Drops the Dragon-Hunter's Great Katana

The Gravesite Plain offers a notable number of Tarnished enemies for the player to face. Either found in the open-world as enemies, or as bosses, the player will find enemies that behave like the player with their playstyle.

The Ancient Dragon-Man is one such encounter, and is found in the Dragon's Pit. He has some basic attack patterns with his weapon, as well as an Ash of War that can deal heavy damage. Aside from that, he can also utilize Dragon Communion incantations such as Dragonmaw and Magma Breath. However, he doesn't have a crazy number of attacks, so his boss fight is quite simple.

9 Red Bear

An Enemy With A Unique But Limited Moveset

  • Found in the Northern Nameless Mausoleum
  • Drops the Red Bear's Claw, Fang Helm, Iron Rivet Armor, Iron Rivet Gauntlets, and the Iron Rivet Greaves

As is often the case with Tarnished enemies, they don't have much of an involved moveset. The Red Bear follows this logic, with some unique attacks, but ones that he will often repeat immediately after using them.

He can deal big damage, but given his use of a fist weapon, it is easy to evade his attacks. However, he does possess a new incantation, the Roar of Rugalea, which can deal more damage to players than his melee attacks, and given it is an AoE spell, dodging it can also be tricky.

8

7 Ghostflame Dragon

A New Dragon Fight That Plays Out The Same As The Old Dragon Bosses

  • Found on the lake in northern Gravesite Plain
  • Drops a Dragon Heart and a Somber Ancient Dragon Smithing Stone

Dragons have always been a major part of FromSoft's Soulsborne games, and Elden Ring was no different. Multiple dragon bosses were found throughout The Lands Between, some more important than others, and each relating to the various elemental damage types in the game.

Of these, there was never a dragon that utilized Ghostflame, but Shadow of the Erdtree fixes that. The Ghostflame Dragon is very similar to the regular dragon bosses found in the base game, with various physical and breath attacks, yet this time it uses ghostflame. There are some new unique attacks, such as when it breathes ghostflame into its own body for an AoE, but it is mostly the same as the dragons fought previously.

6 Furnace Golem

A Simple Fight But A Huge Spectacle

  • Found near the Scorched Ruins and the Ellac River.
  • Drops the Deflecting Hardtear and the Viridian Hidden Tear respectively, with both dropping a Furnace Visage.

Normally, FromSoft's larger bosses tend to be on the easier side, either because of their moveset or because they are a gimmick fight. The Furnace Golems are also a simple fight once their patterns are learned, with only a few attacks to their name.

They usually stomp the ground and cause fire to spread everywhere, with additional attacks involving their arms and fire projectiles. If caught in these attacks, they can cause massive damage to the player, but can also be easily avoided. The highlight of these fights is the spectacle; battling against a giant fire construct that explodes the surrounding area. It makes for great moments, even if the gameplay isn't too involved.

5 Demi-Human Swordmaster Onze

A Boss That Tests The Player's Dodging Skills

  • Found in the Belurat Gaol
  • Drops the Demi-Human Swordsman Yosh Spirit Ashes

Throughout the base game of Elden Ring , the demi-humans weren't too big of a challenge, and were quite easy to defeat. Demi-Human Swordmaster Onze flips the narrative; this is a boss that is extremely fast and deadly.

Appearing as the boss for the Belurat Gaol, Onze uses a bunch of fast attacks that can easily defeat the player. Onze's basic attacks are already fast, but his Ash of War attacks are even deadlier, with moves that seem straight out of the Carian Combo Warriors mod. Onze even has a Vergil-like Judgment Cut, making for a boss that looks unassuming, but can be a challenge for some players.

4 Blackgaol Knight

One Of The First Bosses Players Will Encounter

  • Found in the Western Nameless Mausoleum
  • Drops the Greatsword of Solitude, Helm of Solitude, Armor of Solitude, Gloves of Solitude, and Greaves of Solitude

Aside from the first Furnace Golem, the Blackgaol Knight will most likely be the first boss players encounter in the DLC, and specifically, the first with a dedicated boss health bar. Despite his appearance as a tarnished enemy, the Blackgaol Knight can be a tough encounter, dealing massive damage that can catch players off guard.

His attacks aren't too complex, consisting of basic slashes with his sword, but his Ash of War can kill anyone witnessing it for the first time, especially with the follow-up move he can do. The fight is simply challenging due to the damage he is able to dish out, combined with the player's ability to not deal as much damage as they would expect, given the DLC's new leveling system.

3 Death Knight

A Full 'Guy In Armor' Fight

  • Found in the Fog Rift Catacombs
  • Drops the Death Knight's Twin Axes and the Crimson Amber Medallion +3

A large criticism of Elden Ring was the optional dungeon content scattered throughout The Lands Between. Many players felt that they were all extremely similar, with simple bosses and repetitive layouts.

The Death Knight is a subversion of such criticisms, and is a challenging fight that gives players a reason to do the side dungeons. Despite the name, the Death Knight doesn't utilize deathblight, a relief to many. Instead, the Death Knight uses lightning abilities in addition to axe attacks. His deadliest attack is a grab, which can heal the Death Knight by a significant amount. However, the knight can be backstabbed, so the fight isn't too unfair.

2 Divine Beast Dancing Lion

The First Major Boss Encounter

  • Found in Belurat, Tower Settlement
  • Drops the Remembrance of the Dancing Lion and the Divine Beast Head

As the first major boss that players will most likely fight, the Divine Beast Dancing Lion sets the stage for the difficulty of the bosses in Shadow of the Erdtree . The boss is incredibly fast and agile, with numerous elemental and ranged attacks that make it a tough battle.

It can be frustrating given its less-than-stellar attack telegraphs, but the spectacle of the fight will blow players away. With incredible music and a fantastic boss design, players won't find any negatives on that front, even if they will have to learn the attack patterns more so than other major bosses.

1 Rellana, Twin Moon Knight

Pontiff Sulyvahn, But Somehow Harder

  • Found in Castle Ensis
  • Drops the Remembrance of the Twin Moon Knight

FromSoft are known for reusing past assets, especially in DLCs, and Rellana, Twin Moon Knight might be the biggest example of this. Her appearance obviously brings forth memories of Pontiff Sulyvah from Dark Souls 3 , but she also has elements of Malenia in her moveset.

Rellana is a fast boss. Like, crazy fast, with an insane number of combos that seem to never end. She also has a ranged attack, and a second phase that ups the difficulty even further. Yet, despite all of this, she is still an engaging fight, with players trading blows with her when they can, making for a difficult fight. She further demonstrates how challenging the DLC will be, with her defeat opening up the way to Scadu Altus, where more bosses await.

item.title: Destiny 2 Player Spots a Titan That Looks Just Like Optimus Prime
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Destiny 2 player creates an Optimus Prime-inspired Titan character using in-game shaders and armor pieces.
  • Fans have tried to identify the specific equipment and shaders used for the build in the r/DestinyFashion subreddit.
  • Bungie has no official plans to bring Transformers to Destiny 2, but it's not impossible; the studio has introduced other popular franchises before.

A Destiny 2 player has spotted a Titan Guardian that looks like Optimus Prime from the Transformers franchise. Throughout Destiny 2 ’s solar system, gamers can collect hundreds of pieces of armor, giving them a vast variety of options when it comes to customizing their characters.

The Final Shape expansion was released on June 4 and finally brought the Guardians face-to-face with The Witness, who had been teased throughout Destiny 2 ’s previous expansions. While many are getting to grips with the new weapons that were added with The Final Shape, one player has decided to lead the charge against The Witness with a character based on one of Hasbro’s most iconic heroes.

As spotted by redastray23643 on Reddit, one Guardian has used Optimus Prime as inspiration for their Titan build. The original poster came across the leader of the Autobots in the returning Cathedral of Scars Gambit map, and the character does bear a striking resemblance to Optimus thanks to a clever use of the in-game shaders and carefully selected armor pieces.

A Destiny 2 Player Encounters Titan Inspired By Optimus Prime

Replies to the post have been largely positive, with most players impressed that someone has managed to create a character that looks like Optimus Prime. At the time of writing, fans in the r/DestinyFashion subreddit are trying to identify the equipment and shaders used for the build. One fan suggests that the colors are crucible glory for the head and chest, with another suggesting that most of the armament comes from the Festival of the Lost event held in 2022.

Sadly for fans, there are no official plans to bring Transformers to Destiny 2, but it is not outside the realms of possibility. Bungie is no stranger to introducing popular franchises into the first-person MMO, most recently items from the world of Dungeons and Dragons released into Destiny 2 . The numerous items included an Eye Tyrant Beholder Ghost Shell, Bigby's Fist Finisher, and a Nat-20 Emote, which could be picked up from the in-game store.

Since the release of The Final Shape expansion, Bungie has seen an uptick in player numbers as gamers set out to take on The Witness. While some have felt that the Titan class could have been given more attention, both with the new Prismatic subclass and in general, Bungie has promised further balances to the Titan class will be made in a future update. While there is no current timescale on Titan changes, the speed at which Bungie has been updating Destiny 2 could suggest that an update will arrive sooner rather than later. In the meantime, players can keep making fashion statements like this Optimus Prime-themed Titan did.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14: Dawntrail - Main Quest List
item.description:
Final Fantasy XIV is an amazing online JRPG that allows players to dive into the world of Final Fantasy with their friends. The game follows the player character as they explore the world and engage with the many different expansions it has to offer.

With the Dawntrail expansion, players are able to do 100 new main quests, unlock new jobs (like the Viper and Pictomancer), and explore a whole new area of the game. Here's a breakdown of all the main quests added with the expansion.

All Main Quests (Scenarios) In Dawntrail

The Dawntrail expansion offers 100 new main scenario quests for players to partake in. These quests will allow players to see new places, unlock new items, and build their character to be the best they can be. Here's a list of all 100 quests.

  1. A New World to Explore
  2. The Nation of Tuliyollal
  3. A City of Stairs
  4. A Saga of Stone
  5. The Rite of Succession
  6. To Urqopacha
  7. Traders of Happiness
  8. The Feat of Gold
  9. Mablu’s Dream
  10. A Premium Deal
  11. Wuk Lamat in the Saddle
  12. Knowing the Pelupelu
  13. To Kazama’uka
  14. A Festive of People
  15. The Feat of Reeds
  16. A Well-mannered Shipwright
  17. The Lifting of Wings
  18. Knowing the Hanuhanu
  19. The Success of Others
  20. For All Turali
  21. A Leaking Workpot
  22. Lending a Helphand
  23. The Feat of Pots
  24. A Father First
  25. The Shape of Peace
  26. Lost Promise
  27. A Brother’s Duty
  28. Feeding the River
  29. Sibling Rescue
  30. History’s Keepers
  31. The Feat of Proof
  32. The High Luminary
  33. An Echo of Madness
  34. Pointing the Way
  35. The Skyruin
  36. The Feat of Ice
  37. The Promise of Peace
  38. The Leap to Yak Te’l
  39. Village of the Hunt
  40. A History of Violence
  41. The Feat of Repast
  42. A Father’s Grief
  43. Taking a Stand
  44. Into the Traverse
  45. City of Silence
  46. Blessed Siblings
  47. Scale of Trust
  48. Mamook Speaks
  49. The Feat of the Brotherhood
  50. Road to the Golden City
  51. Dawn of a New Tomorrow
  52. Ever Greater, Ever Brighter
  53. The Long Road to Xak Tural
  54. Saddled Up
  55. Braced for Trouble
  56. Blowing Smoke
  57. Law of the Land
  58. On Track
  59. One with Nature
  60. And the Land Would Tremble
  61. No Time for Tears
  62. Pick up the Pieces
  63. Together as One
  64. In Yyasulani’s Shadow
  65. Putting Plans into Locomotion
  66. A Hot Commodity
  67. All Aboard
  68. The Land of Levin
  69. A Royal Welcome
  70. A Day in the Life
  71. One the Cloud
  72. Gone and Forgotten
  73. Embracing Oblivion
  74. Solution Nine
  75. The Queen’s Tour
  76. Her People, Her Family
  77. Scales of Blue
  78. Gives You Teeth
  79. Little Footfalls
  80. Drowned Vestiges
  81. Memories of a Knight
  82. At a Crossroads
  83. The Protector and the Destroyer
  84. A Comforting Hand
  85. Unto the Summit
  86. The Resilient Son
  87. A New Family
  88. In Pursuit of Sphene
  89. Through the Gate of Gold
  90. Those Who Live Forever
  91. In Serenity and Sorrow
  92. The Land of Dreams
  93. A Knight of Alexandria
  94. The Sanctuary of the Strong
  95. The Taste of Family
  96. Leafing through the Past
  97. An Explorer’s Delight
  98. In Search of Discovery
  99. A Journey Never-ending
  100. Dawntrail
